taxonomicnotes: Nemacheilus triangularis was described by Day in 1865.  The subspecies designated as N. triangularis tambarapaniensis Menon, 1987 from Tambaraparani River may be a distinct species.  Presently it is synonymised under this species (Menon 1987, M. Arunachalam pers. com.).
rationale: Nemacheilus triangularis is a widely distributed species occurring in the Western Ghats of three states of southern India.  Although the species is harvested for aquarium trade and there is no monitoring, the population trends in this commonly occurring and abundant species is stable, hence Least Concern.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Gopalakrishnan, A., Arunachalam, M., Shrikant, J., Johnson, J.A., Rahul, K. & Molur, S.
